title: 107_hr2971
content: SECTION 1. GRANTING OF COPYRIGHT. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. Work subject to copyright. Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna" with different parts like "Di Shank". Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles like "Hurbin" and "Vilna" with different parts such as "Di Shank", "Der Ger-Tzadik", "Di Hiter fun der Shtot", "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern", and "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite". Other works mentioned are "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir", "Dos Alte Hoyz" with alternate titles "Zin un Tahter" and "Der Beth-Horav", and "Fun Unter der Erd" with the first version titled "Froyen fun Ghetto". In section 1, Chaim Grade's works include titles like "Hurbin" and "Vilna" with different parts such as "Di Shank", "Der Ger-Tzadik", "Di Hiter fun der Shtot", "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern", and "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite". Other works mentioned are "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir", "Dos Alte Hoyz" with alternate titles "Zin un Tahter" and "Der Beth-Horav", and "Fun Unter der Erd" with the first version titled "Froyen fun Ghetto". Some other works listed include "Yury Goresha", "Alte Boherim", "In Gerangl mitn Malah", "Chaim Nachman Bialik", "H. Leivik, der Poet fun Laydn un Goyrl", "H. Leivik in Mayn Lehn and Shafn", and "Itzik Manger, der Poet fun Shaynkayt un Shpil". Itzik Manger, the Poet of Beauty and Play, discusses Three Yiddish Classics, Problems of a Yiddish Writer and Yiddish Literature, My Path in Yiddish Literature, Encounter with Soviet Yiddish Writers, and Three Dramatic Poems. Itzik Manger discusses various topics in his works, including encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, three dramatic poems, motives in his works, Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, Sabbath in Yiddish literature, Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, and the Jewish way of life in Eastern Europe. In his works, Itzik Manger discusses encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, dramatic poems, motives, Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, Sabbath in Yiddish literature, Mussarists, Lithuanian Yeshivas, and topics like Rabbi Israel Salanter, Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov, Talmudic scholars in Yiddish literature, and Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life worldwide. In his works, Itzik Manger discusses encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, dramatic poems, motives, Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, Sabbath in Yiddish literature, Mussarists, Lithuanian Yeshivas, Rabbi Israel Salanter, Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov, Talmudic scholars in Yiddish literature, and Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life worldwide. Additionally, he covers various lectures and essays on topics such as Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia, Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, and the greening of Israel. Itzik Manger's works cover various topics such as encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, dramatic poems, Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, Sabbath in Yiddish literature, Mussarists, Lithuanian Yeshivas, Rabbi Israel Salanter, Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov, Talmudic scholars in Yiddish literature, and Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy. He also discusses lectures and essays on Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia, Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, Song of Songs, Saffed, Mount Miron, and the greening of Israel. Additionally, he addresses themes like the uniqueness of Vilna, Jewish life in Vilna before World War II, the new Hebrew literature in Israel, and the survivors of the German concentration camps. Chaim Grade's works include "The Survivors," "Thirty Years Later," "The Soil and the Legend of the Land of Israel," "The Last Controversies Among the Rabbis of Vilna," and "American Yiddish Poets." Additionally, any other works by Chaim Grade, whether published or unpublished, are also included.
